Detailed Description

class that operates the transformation of a ReducedImage (image(s) + list).

As for other descendants of ReducedImage, the actual computations occur when you request the name of a data file (e.g. FitsName()). To geometrically align a set of images on the same reference, use ImagesAlign(). If you want to sum them, uses ImagesAlignAndSum()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TransformedImage::TransformedImage ( const string & Name,
const ReducedImage & Source,
const ImageTransfo * Transfo )
 

to create a new TransformedImage, or locate an existing one.

If you want to align A on B, the typical constructor call will be: TransformedImage(NewName, A, &ImageGtransfo(B,A)); To align a set of images on the same reference, use ImagesAlign().
